channel.title: First program help / New question

item.title: First program help / New question
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“haticks, post:7, topic:165631”][quote author=lawl link=topic=224686.msg1937739#msg1937739 date=1197964707]
if(UserIn == 1);

you have a ‘;’ after your ‘if’ which basically means it wont do anything
so the stuff in {} is executed no matter what, so remove the ; and you’re done
(this is why putting { on a newline is stupid)
[/quote] ok, it works now. Why does it not show up as an error though?[/quote]
Because it is still correct Java syntax.
It wouldn’t show up as a error.

Edit: Shit, lawl posted before me.

Read full topic

item.title: First program help / New question
item.dc:creator: @haticks haticks
item.description:
@haticks wrote:

Ok, scratch what i said earlyer i figured it out. Rather than starting a new thread ill just use this one.

Heres my program so far [code]import java.util.*;

public class MultiTool
{
public static void main(String[] args)
throws java.io.IOException
{

Scanner Input = new Scanner(System.in);
int  UserIn;
int  int1;
int  int2;
int  int3;
int  int4;
int  int5;
int  int6;
int  int7;

System.out.println("Welcome to MultiTool v1 Made by haticks.");
System.out.println("This program has several tools that you may find usfull.");
System.out.println("Here are your choices: ");
System.out.println("");
System.out.println("1. Miles to kilometers.");
System.out.println("2. Fahrenheit to Celsius.");
System.out.println("3. Pounds to grams");
System.out.println("4. Ounces to pounds.");
System.out.println("5. Exit.");
System.out.printf("Please type the number of the tool that you wish too use: ");
UserIn = Input.nextInt();


if(UserIn == 1);
{
	System.out.printf("Please enter the number of miles you would like to convert: ");
	int1 = Input.nextInt();
	int2 = int1 * 8;
	int3 = int2  / 5;
	System.out.println("");
	System.out.println( int1 + " miles is eaqule too " + int3 + " kilometers");

}
if(UserIn == 2);
{
	System.out.printf("Please enter Fahrenheit tempeture: ");
	int4 = Input.nextInt();
	int5 = int4 - 32;
	int6 = int5 * 5;
	int7 = int6 / 9;
	System.out.println(int4 + " converted to Celsius is: " + int7 + " degrees Celsius.");}
}

}[/code]

Ok, it asks me "Please type the number of the tool that you wish too use: " So i type 2 for the Fahrenheit to Celsius Converter, but it asks me "Please enter the number of miles you would like to convert: " Which is choice number 1. Why is it doing this?

Read full topic
